Before the enactment of this Act, if a tax was imposed on liquid held by a dealer for sale, the taxpayer can receive a credit or refund for the excess amount paid. Imposition of Tax: A floor stocks tax is imposed on taxable liquid held on the floor stocks tax date, calculated as the excess of the tax that would be imposed under the Internal Revenue Code if the taxable event occurred on that date. Liability for Tax: The person holding the liquid on the floor stocks tax date is responsible for paying the tax. The tax imposed by subsection (a) must be paid as prescribed by the Secretary within 6 months after the floor stocks tax date. Definitions include considering a liquid as "held by a person" if title has passed to them, and a "taxable liquid" refers to any liquid subject to tax. Establishment of a Commission on Gas Price Relief by the Speaker of the House of Representatives within three months of the Act's enactment. The Commission will study the causes of high oil prices and submit a report to the House within a year. The report will include revenue raisers to replenish the Treasury after any suspension of Federal excise taxes on motor fuels. The Commission on Gas Price Relief will consist of 9 Members, including the Chairmen of the Committees on Ways and Means and Energy and Commerce, along with members appointed by them from different political parties.
